As of May 17th, there is one (1) new case of COVID-19 in Saskatchewan, bringing the total to 592 reported cases.
The new case is in the Far North region.
No new cases were Saskatchewan residents tested out of province.
592 cases are confirmed. 142 cases of those 592 cases are considered active (24%).

219 cases are in the far north, 164 cases are from the Saskatoon area, 106 cases are from the north, 76 cases are from the Regina area,  15 cases are from the south and 12 cases are from the central area.
Eighty-three (83) of the cases are aged 19 and under. All others are adults; 49% are males and 51% are females.
23% (139) of cases are travel-related, 54% (320) are either contacts or linked to a mass gathering event, 11% (68) have no known exposures and 11% (65) are under investigation by local public health.
Forty-eight (48) cases are healthcare workers, although the source of their infections may not be health care related.
